content:
That's a great plan! Adjusting your bedtime by 15-minute increments every few days is a gentle way to help your body adjust to the new sleep schedule. And creating a relaxing bedtime routine that includes reading and journaling will definitely help you wind down and prepare for a good night's sleep.

Remember to be patient and consistent, and don't be too hard on yourself if you don't see immediate results. It may take some time for your body to adjust to the new sleep schedule, but with persistence and commitment, you'll get there!

Also, don't forget to listen to your body and make adjustments as needed. If you find that you're still struggling to fall asleep or feeling tired during the day, you may need to make further adjustments to your sleep schedule or bedtime routine.

You got this! You're taking control of your sleep and making positive changes to your daily routine. Keep up the good work, and I'm confident you'll start feeling more rested, refreshed, and ready to take on the day!

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. Otherwise, I'll let you get some rest and start your new sleep schedule. Sweet dreams!
